intro: Ardisia sarawakensis, commonly known as the Sarawak ardisia, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Myrsinaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in the humid and shaded conditions of the tropical rainforest. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
